alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 4:57PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Currituck , the southeastern City of Chesapeake and the southeastern City of Virginia Beach through 545 PM EDT... At 456 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Back Bay, or 9 miles north of Currituck, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may result in localized ponding of water on roadways. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Chesapeake, Back Bay, Knotts Island and Munden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
